meanings.definition: The act of conglutinating or the state of being conglutinated.
meanings.sent1: The conglutinations of the broken pieces formed a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: After the surgery, the conglutinations of the wound helped it heal quickly.
meanings.sent3: The conglutinations of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to separate them.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like the conglutinations of two souls, inseparable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The conglutinations of the ingredients created a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: The process of healing by the first intention, or without suppuration; adhesion of the edges of a wound.
meanings.sent1: The conglutinations of the wound allowed it to heal without any complications.
meanings.sent2: Doctors were amazed by the conglutinations of the skin after the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The conglutinations of the wound edges seemed to have a magical healing power.
meanings.sent4: The conglutinations of the wound were like nature's own bandage, sealing the injury.
meanings.sent5: The conglutinations of the wound were so perfect, it was as if the body knew how to mend itself.
